Screensavers are a great addition to any computer, providing not only entertainment but also security. With Windows 7, users have a range of screensavers to choose from, each offering its unique visuals and functionality. In this article, we will explore the different types of screensavers available on Windows 7 and how they can enhance your desktop experience.

## What are screensavers?

Screensavers are programs that automatically appear on your computer screen after a certain period of inactivity. They are designed to prevent image burn-in on your display, which can occur when the same image is displayed for an extended period. Screensavers work by continuously changing the image displayed on your screen, preventing any static image from being displayed for too long.

## Types of screensavers available on Windows 7

Windows 7 ships with a range of screensavers that can be accessed via the Personalization settings. Some of the popular screensavers include:

### 1. Bubbles

The Bubbles screensaver displays bubbles of varying sizes and colors moving randomly around your screen. The bubbles can either be created with your mouse or touchpad or move on their own. The Bubbles screensaver is simple yet mesmerizing, making it an excellent addition to any desktop.

### 2. Mystify

The Mystify screensaver displays a series of multicolored lines that move in a hypnotic pattern around your screen. The lines change shape and color, creating fascinating visuals that will add a touch of mystery to your desktop.

### 3. Ribbons

The Ribbons screensaver displays ribbons of different colors moving across your screen in a captivating dance. The ribbons move gracefully, creating an elegant display that is sure to impress anyone who sees your computer screen.

### 4. Aurora

The Aurora screensaver displays a beautiful animation of the Northern Lights, also known as the Aurora Borealis. The visuals are breathtaking, transporting you to a different world where the sky is alive with color and movement.

## How to enable screensavers on Windows 7

To enable screensavers on a Windows 7 computer, follow these simple steps:

1. Right-click on your desktop and select Personalize
2. Click on Screen Saver at the bottom-right corner of the window
3. Choose your favorite screensaver from the dropdown menu
4. Set the time before the screensaver appears by adjusting the Wait time slider
5. Click Apply and then OK to save your changes.

## Conclusion

Screensavers are a fun and practical addition to any computer. With Windows 7, users have a range of screensavers to choose from, each offering a unique visual and practical experience. Whether you want to add a touch of elegance, mystery, or simply want to enjoy beautiful animations, Windows 7 has a screensaver for you.
